III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation During a physical escalation and attempted property damage, a
staff member was observed pushing a youth to the ground. The
youth sustained a swollen and bruised right wrist and thumb.
There was a small abrasion to the knuckle due to punching
windows, walls, and doors. The youth has pain in the right
buttocks from being pushed, but there was no visible injury.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Director was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/17/25
in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Director reported Youth
A’s injuries to his knuckles, wrist and thumb are likely due to
Youth A punching various items around the unit. Director reported
Youth A’s pain on his butt is likely due to being pushed by Staff 1
because Youth A landed against the wooden arm rest of a chair
prior to falling on the ground. Director reported there was no
visible injury on Youth A’s buttocks after the incident. Director
reported Staff 1 is on administrative leave pending the
investigation.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/17/25
in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported he
forgot much of what happened during the situation because he
was so mad he blacked out. Youth A reported he got into a fight
with Youth B. Youth A reported when he and Youth B were
fighting on the floor, Staff 1 grabbed him around his belly, and
then Youth A reported he got off of Youth B. Youth A reported he
went to his room after this, but then he went into the milieu
bathroom, broke the toilet and flooded the bathroom. Youth A
reported he had a pencil and was holding it up to get all the staff
away from him. Youth A reported at one point, Staff 1 pushed him,
and he hit his butt on the arm of the chair, and his butt is all
bruised. Youth A reported Staff 1 pushed him because Youth A
was trying to pull the wires and he punched the TV. Youth A
reported at another point, he punched Staff 1 in the chest, and
Youth E tried to walk towards him. Youth A reported Staff 1
shoved Youth E backwards.
2

Attempts were made to interview Youth B face to face at the
facility on 7/17/24 and 7/24/24 in coordination with MDHHS
Worker. Youth B refused to talk about the situation and stated he
“doesn’t want to talk about negative stuff like that”.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/17/25
in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Youth C reported Youth B
was standing in the middle of the room when Youth A walked past
Youth B and Youth B told Youth A to get out of his personal
space. Youth C reported Youth A said, “I don’t care”, and then
Youth B punched Youth A. Youth C reported he told staff (couldn’t
remember who) that Youth A and Youth B were about to fight.
Youth C reported Staff 4 was in the milieu watching them at the
time, but he was writing something down. Youth C reported when
Staff 4 looked up from what he was doing, Youth A and Youth B
were already fighting on the floor. Youth C reported Staff 1 and
Staff 2 separated Youth A and Youth B by pulling Youth A off
Youth B, and putting him to the side, but no one threw Youth A to
the side. Youth C reported Youth A tried to go back and fight
Youth B multiple times, but staff (couldn’t remember who) stopped
him. Youth C reported Youth B went to his room.
Youth C reported Youth A was walking around the unit punching
fire alarms, walls, the TV, windows, etc. Youth C reported Youth A
was also trying to flip chairs, tables, and break anything in his
way. Youth C reported Youth A went into the milieu bathroom and
began breaking things in the bathroom. Youth C reported when
Youth A exited the bathroom, he thinks Staff 1 and Staff 2
restrained Youth A, but he couldn’t remember exactly. Youth C
reported after the restraint Youth A was still escalated. Youth C
reported Youth A went to his room at some point, but he’s not sure
when he went there or what he did in there. Youth C reported
throughout the incident Youth A was threatening to punch and
stab staff. Youth C reported at one point, Youth A pulled out a
mechanical pencil, and Staff 2 grabbed the pencil out of his
hands. Youth C reported Youth A then got another pencil out of
the couch. Youth C reported when Youth A was trying to break the
TV, staff were trying to tell Youth A not to break the TV. Youth C
reported Staff 1 pushed Youth A away from the TV because Youth
A tried to break it again. Youth C reported Staff 1 pushed Youth A
into the chair in the TV area, but he doesn’t think Staff 1 was
trying to hurt Youth A or intentionally push him down. Youth C
reported he believes it was just an accident. Youth C reported
staff continuously tried to verbally de-escalate Youth A, but he
didn’t listen.
3

Youth C reported at one point, Youth A threatened Staff 1 with a
pencil, therefore Youth E tried to fight Youth A, but Staff 2 stepped
in, pushed Youth E backwards, and told him to stay out of the
situation. Youth C reported eventually he and the rest of the youth
were told to go to their rooms to allow Youth A to calm down.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/17/25
in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Youth D reported he was
in his room when he woke up to Youth A and Youth B screaming.
Youth D reported when he got into the milieu, Staff 3 told him
Youth A and Youth B began fighting, which Youth D reported is a
common occurrence. Youth D reported Youth A and Youth B tried
to run towards each other, but Staff 1 and Staff 2 stopped them.
Youth D reported Staff 4 was in the office making calls. Youth D
reported Staff 1 let Youth A into the milieu bathroom and Youth A
broke the mirror, toilet and sink. Youth D reported then Youth A
began fighting with Youth B again. Youth D reported Staff 1
restrained Youth A so he couldn’t keep punching Youth B. Youth
D described the restraint as Staff 1 picking Youth A up from
behind and then holding his arms. Youth D reported Staff 1 never
threw Youth A to the ground. Youth D reported Youth A punched
the TV a couple of times, but he never saw Youth A get pushed.
Youth D reported Youth E tried to run towards Youth A, but Staff 1
put his arm out to stop him, and then Youth E went back and
stood by the table. Youth D reported after a little while Staff 5
came onto the unit and Youth D and the rest of the youth went to
their rooms.
Youth E was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/17/25
in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Youth E reported he came
back from work, went to his room, and then came back out of his
room. Youth E reported Youth A was on the unit trying to break
things to hurt himself. Youth E reported Staff 1, Staff 2 and Staff 3
were trying to keep Youth A away from sharp objects. Youth E
reported Youth A kept saying he was going to kill staff with the
pencil he had. Youth E reported Staff 2 held onto Youth A while
Staff 1 tried to get the pencil away from him. Youth E reported
Youth A went to the ground on his own, and Staff 1 pulled Youth
A's fingers apart to get the pencil away from him. Youth E reported
at another point, Youth A was trying to hit one of the staff
(wouldn’t say who), therefore Youth E tried to fight Youth A. Youth
E reported he was pushed away from the situation by a staff
(wouldn’t disclose who). Youth E would not discuss any parts of
the situation further.
4

Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/17/25
in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported he and
Staff 3 were about to take the youth to kid’s club to do an activity.
Staff 1 reported he and Staff 3 went to the office to grab some
gaming controllers. Staff 1 reported Youth B and a few other youth
(didn’t specify who) were going, but Youth A wasn’t allowed to go
due to behaviors. Staff 1 reported when he and Staff 3 were in the
staff office, they saw Youth A and Youth B fighting, therefore he
and Staff 3 separated them. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 was nearby,
but he didn’t think Staff 2 helped separate the youth. Staff 1
reported Youth A seemed like he still wanted to fight Youth B
therefore, Staff 1 and Staff 3 encouraged Youth B to go to his
room to separate from Youth A, which Youth B agreed to do. Staff
1 reported Youth A was still escalated, but he decided to go to his
room with Staff 2. Staff 1 reported Youth A was throwing things
and making loud noises in his room. Staff 1 reported while Youth
A was in his room, Youth B came back into the milieu. Staff 1
reported Youth A came out of his room, looked into the milieu from
the hallway window, and then he came into the milieu again. Staff
1 reported there was a brief fight between Youth A and Youth B
before they were separated again, and Youth B went back to his
room.
Staff 1 reported Youth A went into the milieu bathroom and there
were some loud noises and then a big boom. Staff 1 reported
when Youth A exited the bathroom, Staff 1 saw the toilet was
broken and there was water coming out from the toilet seat. Staff
1 reported Youth A tried to break things around the milieu and TV
room. Staff 1 reported he tried to block anything that could
compromise the safety of the program (i.e. key fobs that could
prevent exit). Staff 1 reported Youth A began engaging in property
destruction towards the key fob and fire alarm stations. Staff 1
reported he was blocking Youth A when Youth A pulled a sharp
pencil out of his pocket and pointed it towards Staff 1. Staff 1
reported he reached out, grabbed the pencil out of Youth A’s hand
and put it in the staff office. Staff 1 reported Youth A began to
bang on the TV, and he tried to block Youth A from the TV so
Youth A wouldn’t break it and create more sharp objects. Staff 1
reported Youth A tried to hit him in his face a couple of times, so
Staff 1 put his arms up to block Youth A. Staff 1 reported Youth A
approached him with his hand in his pocket, so it looked like Youth
A had another sharp object. Staff 1 reported he put his arms out to
create space when Youth A came towards him and Youth A
stumbled back and fell. Staff 1 reported Staff 5 arrived to provide
support and after Staff 5’s arrival, Youth A seemed to regulate.
Staff 1 reported he tried to talk to Youth A later in the evening, but
5

Youth A refused to talk to him. Staff 1 reported it’s possible he
pushed Youth A when Youth A was running towards Youth B to
fight him. Staff 1 reported if he pushed Youth A, he didn’t shove
him with force, and only kept his arms out to keep space and/or
block Youth A. Staff 1 reported when Youth A and Youth B were
on the ground fighting at one point, he pulled Youth A off of Youth
B. Staff 1 reported he doesn’t remember throwing Youth A to the
side, and reported it wasn’t his intention to do so. Staff 1 reported
at one point, Youth E tried to get involved in the situation by trying
to fight Youth A, therefore Staff 1 stopped Youth E and pushed
him backwards to stay out of it.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/17/25
in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported after
transition time, he, Staff 1 and Staff 3 were standing by the staff
office talking about what was going to happen the rest of the day
with the youth. Staff 2 reported his back was facing the unit. Staff
3 was facing the unit and told Staff 1 and Staff 2, Youth A and
Youth B looked like they were going to fight. Staff 2 reported he
and Staff 1 separated Youth A and Youth B. Staff 2 reported
Youth B was taken to his room and away from the situation. Staff
2 reported shortly later, Youth B came back out into the milieu for
some reason, and Youth A went back to fight him. Staff 2 reported
Staff 1 and Staff 3 broke up the fight, and Youth B was brought
back to his room. Staff 2 reported Youth A began to tear up the
unit. Staff 2 reported Staff 4 made calls to nursing and Staff 5 for
support. Staff 2 reported Youth A threatened to stab Staff 1 a
couple times and then hit him. Staff 2 reported Youth A found a
pencil in the crevice of a chair and found another pencil another
time during the incident. Staff 2 reported Youth A also broke off a
piece of plastic from the fire alarm station. Staff 2 reported Youth
A hit him in the chest twice and hit Staff 1 in the chest a couple
times, while also continuing threats towards them. Staff 2 reported
when Youth A was in the TV room, he was trying to bust the TV
glass apart. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 initially blocked the TV, but
then Youth A tried to stab Staff 1 with a pencil. Staff 2 reported
Staff 1 tried to grab the pencil out of Youth A’s hand, and as that
happened, Youth A fell backwards. Staff 2 reported Youth A
complained Staff 1 pushed him and stated his butt hurt. Staff 2
reported he didn’t see Staff 1 push Youth A because Staff 1’s
back was facing Staff 2 and Staff 2 couldn’t see around Staff 1.
Staff 2 reported he wasn’t sure if Staff 1 pushed Youth A, or if
Youth A fell off the chair because he was standing on it and lost
his balance. Staff 2 reported at one point, Youth A looked at his
wrists and said to Staff 1, “oh yeah, you’re fired”, but Staff 2 wasn’t
sure what Youth A saw on his wrists to make him say that.
6

Staff 2 reported Youth E and Staff 1 are close, so when Youth A
kept targeting Staff 1, Youth E tried to get involved and defend
Staff 1. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 got in between Youth A and Youth
E to stop Youth E. Staff 2 reported he didn’t feel Staff 1 pushed
Youth E and stated Staff 1 moved in between the two youth with
his hand out to stop Youth E. Staff 2 reported when Staff 5
arrived, he sat down with Youth A, and they began to process the
situation. Staff 2 reported Nurse 1 also processed with Youth A
when she arrived, gave him an Ibuprofen and gave him his PRN
medication. Staff 2 reported Youth A complained about his butt
hurting and about a scratch on his hand. Staff 2 reported he and
Nurse 2 went with Youth A to his room to examine him and there
was no bruising on his butt.
Staff 2 reported he and Staff 4 processed the situation with Youth
A approximately 10 minutes after Nurse 1 left. Staff 2 reported
asking Youth A what happened because he’s been doing so well.
Youth A told Staff 2 earlier in the day his foster care worker told
him he might not be going to his home visit the upcoming
weekend because his level dropped at the facility. Youth A
explained in his mind his foster care worker told him no even
though she said she would think about it. Youth A reported he felt
he did all the work at the facility for nothing. Staff 2 reported Youth
A showed remorse for his actions and took accountability. Staff 2
reported before he left for the day, he processed with Youth A
once more about actions, consequences, etc. Staff 2 reported he
feels he and the other staff could have gotten the other youth into
their rooms and away from the situation quicker. Staff 2 reported
he did not see any staff doing anything in appropriate during the
incident. Staff 2 felt they were doing a lot to verbally de-escalate
Youth A and encourage Youth A to do better.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/17/25
in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported he went
to get the gaming controllers for kid’s club and when he went back
into the milieu, Youth A and Youth B were fighting. Staff 3
reported he separated Youth B away from Youth A and took him
to his room. Staff 3 reported when he came back into the milieu,
Youth A was upset and pacing. Staff 3 reported Youth A was
brought to his room to calm down. Staff 3 reported Youth B came
into the milieu to ask if he could come out of his room, and he was
told yes. Staff 3 reported Youth A then came out of his bedroom
hallway and attacked Youth B. Staff 3 reported Youth A and Youth
B fell on the floor as they were fighting. Staff 3 reported Staff 1
stood over Youth A, straddled him, and pulled Youth A off Youth
7

B. Staff 3 reported Staff 1 did not throw Youth A. Staff 3 reported
he got Youth B away and took him back to his room. Staff 3
reported Youth A was upset about the fight and began pacing
again. Staff 3 reported Youth A began trying to destroy the key fob
readers, fire alarm stations, and TV. Staff 3 reported he and Staff
1 kept blocking items so Youth A couldn’t destroy them. Staff 3
reported he left to retrieve food for dinner, and when he came
back, the incident was still occurring. Staff 3 reported Youth A
stood on a chair to try to break the TV. Staff 3 reported Youth A
also tried to fight him, Staff 1 and Staff 2. Staff 3 reported
throughout the incident, Youth A had two different pencils, a pop
can topper, and a plastic piece off the fire alarm cover in his
pocket. Staff 3 reported he repeatedly tried to use these objects to
stab Staff 1. Staff 3 reported Youth A kept going towards Staff 1
and Staff 1 held his arms out to keep space between them. Staff 3
reported Staff 2 told him he walked past the TV room and heard
Youth A say Staff 1 pushed him, but Staff 3 reported he didn’t see
what happened.
Staff 3 reported Staff 4 was in the staff office the entire time, so
Staff 3 kept walking around the unit to keep things in check and
assist with the youth. Staff 3 reported at one point Youth E tried to
fight Youth A because Youth A tried to fight Staff 1. Staff 3
reported Staff 1 pushed Youth E away from the situation. Staff 3
reported when Staff 5 arrived, Youth A began to calm down. Staff
3 reported Nurse 1 then came and gave Youth A his PRN
medication, which calmed Youth A down completely. Staff 3
reported the only thing they should have done differently during
the situation was get the other youth off the unit while staff were
handling the incident with Youth A.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/17/25
in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 reported Youth A
and Youth B were having a conversation with Youth C. Staff 4
reported he’s not sure what was said or what happened in the
moment, but he could immediately tell the conversation had
shifted a bit. Staff 4 reported Youth A and Youth B began fighting
each other and fell to the ground. Staff 4 reported Staff 3 got
Youth B away, and Staff 1 stayed with Youth A. Staff 4 reported
Staff 3 took Youth B to his room to get him out of the milieu, which
Youth B agreed to. Staff 4 reported when Staff 3 returned, Youth
A was with Staff 1 and Staff 2. Staff 4 reported Youth A began
screaming, pacing, and threatening staff. Staff 4 reported Youth A
kept trying to find things to break (TV, throwing a chair, punching
things on the wall such as the fire alarm and key fob). Staff 4
reported Youth A threatened to stab Staff 1 with a pencil he had in
8

the middle of the incident. Staff 4 reported Staff 1 took the pencil
out of Youth A’s hand by grabbing it without any struggle. Staff 4
reported he was keeping the time log and made the required calls
to nursing and evening campus security. Staff 4 reported Staff 1
and Staff 3 put Youth A in a level one AEGIS hold and then
released Youth A because he calmed down. Staff 4 reported after
Staff 1 and Staff 3 released the hold, Youth A escalated again, so
they had to re-engage. Staff 4 reported Staff 2 was the shift
supervisor, so he was watching the entire incident. Staff 4
reported he was watching while he was making calls. Staff 4
reported he had to go out to the back of the building because
evening campus security (couldn’t remember the staff’s name)
was outside and couldn’t get in. Staff 4 reported when he and the
other staff (couldn’t remember his name) came into the unit, Staff
4 helped lead Youth C, Youth D and Youth E to their rooms and
out of the area.
Staff 4 reported when he returned to the milieu, Youth A was in a
hold by the windows (couldn’t remember which staff were
involved), and then they moved Youth A to the chairs in the TV
area and let him sit there for a bit. Staff 4 reported Youth A tried to
break the TV and the chairs. Staff 4 reported Nurse 2 came onto
the unit and gave Youth A his PRN medication and some water.
Staff 4 reported Nurse 2 took Youth A to his room and to the
bathroom to talk to him and view his injuries as Youth A was
complaining about his tailbone hurting and bruises on his hand.
Staff 4 reported he didn’t see anything inappropriate happening,
such as pushing or pulling, by any staff during the entire incident.
Nurse 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/24/25
in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Nurse 2 reported he
examined Youth A on 7/17/25 for a bruise on his butt. Nurse 2
reported Youth A had a bruise on his buttocks approximately 4-5
inches in diameter, which was dark purple. Youth A told Nurse 2
he received the bruise from someone (didn’t say who) pushing
him into a chair. Nurse 2 reported Youth A did not complain of
being in pain.
VIDEO REVIEWED:
Video footage from 7/14/25 was reviewed. It should be noted the
video does not have audio. Youth A and Youth B get into an
altercation with Staff 4 watching. It appears to begin as playful but
then ends up with Youth A and Youth B on the ground fighting
with each other. Staff 3 separates Youth B and takes him to the
side of the room. Staff 1 and Staff 2 separate Youth A to another
side of the room and then Staff 1 moves away while Staff 2
9

continues to watch Youth A. Youth A then goes around Youth C to
try to get to Youth B. Youth B has his arms up preparing to fight.
Staff 1 stops Youth A and guides Youth A on his upper arms into
the corner and blocks him into the corner against the wall so he
cannot get out; however, Youth A isn't fighting against him. Staff 1
backs up and Youth A walks into the milieu. Staff 1 stands in
between Youth A and Youth B while Staff 2 follows Youth B to
ensure nothing else happens and guides Youth B out of the milieu
into the bedroom hallway.
Youth A begins pacing around the milieu. Youth A goes to the
door for Youth B's bedroom hallway, but cannot get in. Staff 1 and
Staff 3 come out of Youth B's bedroom hallway with Youth B.
Youth A tries to attack Youth B, but Staff 1, Staff 2 & Staff 3 stop
him by getting in front of Youth A to block him. Youth B runs away
to the other side of the room. Youth A tries to go after Youth B
again and Staff 1 blocks his way again. Youth A goes into his
bedroom hallway with Staff 2. Staff 1 enters the bedroom hallway
(which is off the camera view). Staff 3 is in the milieu with Youth B,
Youth C, and Youth D. Staff 1 and Staff 2 come back into the
milieu with a chair. Youth A is still in the bedroom hallway/his
room. Youth A comes out of his bedroom hallway and immediately
goes after Youth B, but Staff 1, Staff 2 and Staff 3 get in between
them. Youth A goes into the milieu bathroom. Youth A comes into
the milieu and then goes back into the bathroom again. Youth A
comes out again and immediately goes after Youth B. Youth B
punches Youth A, and then Youth A tackles Youth B to the
ground. Youth B keeps punching at Youth A. Staff 1 intervenes by
standing over straddling Youth A, grabs Youth A around his torso,
picks him up and throws him away from the situation, onto the
ground, and Youth A lands on his side. Youth B gets up and is
taken away from Youth A by Staff 3. Staff 1 is still with Youth A.
Youth A gets up, squats on the floor, and then stands up. Staff 1
stands by Youth A and blocks his way from getting to Youth B.
Staff 3 takes Youth B to his bedroom hallway.
Staff 1 gets out of Youth A's way since Youth B is in his bedroom
hallway. Youth A walks towards his bedroom hallway door and
kicks it with his right foot. Then he goes into the TV area where
Youth C is sitting and kicks a chair with his right foot. Staff 1 tried
to stop the chair from falling over and set it on its side. Youth A
walks into the milieu area with Staff 1 following him. Youth A hits a
door and then goes and stands in a corner. Staff 1 opens the
kitchen door and Youth A tries to go into the kitchen but Staff 1
blocks him from entering. Youth A continues to pace around the
milieu with Staff 2 and Staff 1 watching/following. Youth A kicks a
10

door and punches the fire alarm pull station with his right hand.
Youth A then walks into the living room and hits the TV with his
right hand. Youth C is sitting down in the TV area with Staff 1 and
Youth A. Youth A walks back into the milieu and Staff 1 continues
following him. Staff 4 and Staff 2 are blocking fob readers (as
Youth A has broken those in the past). Youth A looks like his fist is
clenched or he has something in his hand. Staff 1 follows Youth A,
and Youth A turns to face Staff 1. Staff 1 grabs Youth A's right
wrist/hand/forearm and they struggle over what is in Youth A’s
hand before something falls to the ground. Staff 1 holds onto
Youth A's right wrist while Staff 1 uses his other hand to pick the
object off the floor. Staff 1 lets Youth A go once he picks it up and
then Staff 1 walks into the staff office.
Youth A tries to break the fire alarm pull station by punching it
twice with his right fist and once with his left. Staff 1 exits the staff
office. Staff 3 is next to Youth A and begins following Youth A to
the milieu front door. Youth A hits the fob reader with his left hand.
Something falls to the ground and Staff 1 picks it up. Staff 1, Staff
2 and Staff 3 are in the front corner with Youth A, but it is unclear
what's happening as it's off camera view. Youth A kicks Staff 1.
Staff 1 is on one side of Youth A and Staff 3 is on the other side of
Youth A and it looks like they're in a standing two person AEGIS
hold, but it’s hard to tell as the camera only shows from
approximately their waists down. Youth A thrashes and Staff 1
and Staff 3 shuffle with him in the restraint and away from the wall.
Staff 1 and Staff 3 walk with him away from the wall, and the
restraint is appropriate. Staff 1's hand is on the back of Youth A's
head to protect himself from head-butts from Youth A. Staff 1 then
moves his hand to the middle of Youth A's back and they remain
in the restraint hold in the milieu. When they walk towards the
milieu, Youth A attempts to sit down, so they release the hold.
Youth A walks into the milieu with Staff 1 and Staff 2 following
him. Youth A stomps on the ground, Staff 1 kicks something out of
the way and Staff 3 removes it from the milieu. Youth A continues
to pace around the milieu.
Youth E comes out of the bedroom hallway. Youth A kicks the
bedroom hallway door with his right foot and then continues to
pace around the milieu and punches the fire alarm pull station with
his left hand. Youth A goes to the front door and Staff 2 blocks him
into the corner but it’s unclear what happens because it's off
camera. Youth A tries or succeeds in picking something off the
ground and Staff 2 is blocking him from it. Staff 1 and Staff 3 go by
them. Youth A drops himself to the floor and staff walk away.
Youth A donkey kicks the supervisor door with his right foot five
11

times. Staff 2 is standing in front of the front door fob reader. Staff
3 and Staff 1 give him space but are observing. Youth A puts
himself in the corner by the supervisor door. Then Youth A paces
around the milieu and approaches Staff 2. Staff 2 blocks the fob
reader. Youth A walks away and punches the fire alarm pull
station 6 times alternating hands and then tries to rip it off the wall.
Youth A then punches it 10 more times alternating hands (mostly
right hand) and then punches it two more times consecutively with
his right hand. Something falls and Staff 1 picks it up off the
ground. Staff 3 leads Youth A away.
Youth A goes by the kitchen door and grabs something on it.
Youth A continues to pace, punches the window 3 times with his
right hand, kicks the outside door with his right foot, and then
continues to pace again. Youth A looks at his right hand
repeatedly. Youth A climbs on the TV chairs to access the TV,
attempts to pull wires, and then hits the TV case with his right
elbow twice. Youth A stands on the arms of the chair and hits the
TV case once with his left elbow. Staff 1 is with him in the TV
area. Staff 1 puts his foot on a chair, touches Youth A's left arm,
and Youth A jumps down off the chair. Youth A approaches Staff 1
in the TV area and goes into his own pocket. Staff 1 pushes Youth
A backwards with two hands in a forward motion which makes
Youth A stumble backwards. Youth A kicks the chair with his right
foot, walks towards Staff 1 and then sits in the chair under the TV.
Staff 1 moves to the other side of Youth A where he has more
space and picks up something off the ground. Youth A walks
towards the TV again with Staff 1 behind him and Staff 1 blocks
